subject: AI
title: Workflow Versioning
description: Safely updating workflows without breaking in-flight processing.

hook.text: You update the classification prompt in production. Halfway through the queue, results change: old items used prompt v1, new items use prompt v2. Your analytics are now comparing apples to oranges.

buildup.text: Workflow versioning: tagging each workflow run with the version of prompts, models, and logic used. This ensures reproducibility and makes it safe to update workflows.

discovery.text: Version everything: prompt templates, model names, model versions, workflow logic, and output schemas. Store the version with each processed item so you can trace what produced what.

twist.text: In-flight transitions are tricky: when you deploy v2, items already in the queue were prepared for v1. Strategies: drain the queue before switching, run v1 and v2 in parallel, or make versions backward-compatible.

climax.text: Versioning enables: safe rollbacks, A/B testing between versions, compliance auditing, and debugging. If something breaks, you know exactly which version caused it.

punchline.text: If you don't version your workflows, every update is a one-way door. Version everything.

quiz.question: Why is workflow versioning important for AI workflows?
options: It enables safe rollbacks, A/B testing, debugging, and ensures reproducibility of results
